item.title: Litter bins over spilling, 2nd August
item.description:
The litter bins opposite Co-op are over spilling with no room to add anything else. This is resulting in people leaving rubbish such as coffee cups on the ground. They need emptying more regularly. There are two bins on that strip plus the bin outside Nisa was full.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 393, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Lime bike, 2nd August
item.description:
There is an abandoned Lime Bike on Green Lane just as you're about to go over the railway bridge (heading towards Eltham, not 5 ways). It is in the gap behind the old telephone box next to the gate to the railway line. It needs collecting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging at top of Belvedere Road, 2nd August
item.description:
Very low overhanging tree that is obstructing most of the pavement meaning you would have to pend down very low to walk under it or go into the road to avoid it. I have a son who I walk with regularly in his pram and I have to go into the road when I pass this bit of pavement which is not safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Belvedere Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 9 wheelie bins lined up on pavement outside No45 & 47., 2nd August
item.description:
Just beyond this property is Lingwood. The residents of Lingwood are over 60 and some are disabled and partially blind. It is also an ugly sight. Would you kindly ask them to move them all onto their property. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18;20, Three Corners, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
